Boli Bolingoli exited Celtic this week almost two years after the lockdown incident that put fuel on the dumpster fire of the pandemic season. The Belgian hasn’t played much for Celtic since then, the defender shipped out to Turkey during the behind closed door campaign. Ange Postecoglou played Boli one time in a competitive game […]

articles.title: EXCLUSIVE: CELTIC FANS EUPHORIC AND ENRAGED AFTER TITLE WIN: DAVIE HAY REVEALS ALL

articles.description:
Photo by Ian MacNicol/Getty Images
  

 The main news from Celtic Park today was the unsurprising exit of Boli Bolingoli, the man who caused grown men to put his surname on their twitter display names back in 2019. 


      I Boli Bolingoli tekende voor twee seizoenen en komt de linkerflank van KVM versterken ❤️Meer info  https://t.co/GtKClzCuaH#trotsoponzekleuren #Boliisnekakker— KV Mechelen (@kvmechelen) July 12, 2022



The left back joined KV Mechelen earlier today in a permanent deal. 
The writing has indeed been on the wall for the much maligned Belgian, who incurred the wrath of Neil Lennon, the entire support and of course the wonderful Scottish Government in August 2020 after THAT flight to Spain. 


Celtic boss Neil Lennon says there’s been no explaination from Boli Bolingoli about why he flew to Spain for an overnight. “I’m absolutely livid, it’s a total betrayal of trust” pic.twitter.com/eLZivwB35w— Clyde 1 Superscoreboard (@ClydeSSB) August 11, 2020



Nicola Sturgeon even gave Scottish Football the dreaded yellow card!


  Nicola Sturgeon hands Scottish football a yellow card  and warns next time it will be a red  #Bolingoli #nicolasturgeon  pic.twitter.com/DUhDPpTYpu— The Daily Record (@Daily_Record) August 11, 2020



He infamously made an appearance in the brutal 1-0 loss at the Anthony Macaroni last season too! 


Guess who is back for Celtic Boli Bolingoli has been handed a surprise start by Ange Postecoglou, can he take the chance against Livingston? ⬇️⬇️⬇️ https://t.co/u6Ae876Qjc pic.twitter.com/X1VfmtO1Gb— Daily Record Sport (@Record_Sport) September 19, 2021



Then weighed in with an assist for David Turnbull’s screamer against Motherwell at Fir Park. 
Here’s the goals from that game:


David Turnbull struck a glorious goal on his first appearance back at Fir Park for Celtic as the visitors beat Motherwell 2-0  pic.twitter.com/34JzlKKx99— Sky Sports Scotland (@ScotlandSky) October 16, 2021



He came, he worked a lot of people into a shoot and he left.
Boli Bolingoli, thank you for your service and all the best, I suppose.
TOMORROW: Banik Ostrava V Celtic - ‘reaction’ of sorts.
articles.title: Boli Bolingoli away

articles.description: THERE are certain misconceptions that people may have about Cameron Carter-Vickers by virtue of his imposing physical stature. He isn’t called ‘The Fridge’ because he is cool under pressure, though that is one of the attributes that has made him such a good fit for Ange Postecoglou’s Celtic.
articles.title: Cameron Carter-Vickers thanks parents and Tottenham mentor as gentle giant expresses gratitude for Celtic opportunity

articles.description: FORMER Celtic midfielder Peter Grant reckons that one of Scotland's three  domestic cup competitions should be scrapped - as the congested fixture list is having an adverse effect on lower league clubs and the national team.
articles.title: Former Celtic midfielder Peter Grant calls for domestic cup competition to be axed

articles.description: CALLUM McGREGOR says that Celtic are hoping to pull Real Madrid out of the hat in the Champions League, with the club captain aiming for personal redemption against Luka Modric.
articles.title: Celtic skipper Callum McGregor targets Luka Modric revenge mission in Champions League

articles.description: MATT O’RILEY says that Celtic expect their rivals to come back at them stronger next season, but that will be irrelevant if Ange Postecoglou’s team play to their potential.
articles.title: Matt O’Riley expects rivals to roar back, but thinks Celtic will have too much for the competition

articles.description: THE movement of Kyogo has left many a defender dizzy since he burst onto the scene at Celtic last season, but his speed is such that it is often difficult even for his own teammates to keep up with him.
articles.title: Kyogo is even a step ahead of Celtic teammates says David Turnbull, as he relishes link-up with striker next season

articles.description: WITH the greatest of respect to MK Dons, the rise of their former captain Matt O’Riley has been a remarkable one over the past six months or so. Not only has the young midfielder become an integral member of the Celtic squad, but he may well find himself at the World Cup come the end of the year.
articles.title: Matt O’Riley aiming to cap off Celtic rise with World Cup place – with a little help from Morten Wieghorst

articles.description: SCOTT BAIN is set to remain at Celtic this season due to Champions League ruling.
articles.title: Scott Bain's Celtic summer transfer conundrum as Champions League ruling set to make his decision

articles.description: JAMES FORREST is a player who, it would be fair to say, has sometimes split opinion among the Celtic fanbase during his long career at the club. For a winger, it comes with the territory.
articles.title: James Forrest not content with making up the numbers at Celtic as winger looks to become main player for Ange Postecoglou

articles.description: KYOGO has set himself a minimum target of 20 goals next season as he looks to wrest the title of Scotland’s top scorer away from teammate Giorgos Giakoumakis.
articles.title: Kyogo sets goal target as he vows to oust Celtic teammate from top of scoring charts
